alert.note: Alert for Morton (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central North Dakota, including the following county, Morton. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Expect rises in small creeks and streams in the Advisory area, including Rice Creek. Flows will remain elevated tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 820 PM CDT, Thunderstorms and heavier showers have ended over the advisory area. However, it will still take some time for the heavy rain that fell earlier, to make it`s way into the Cannonball and Missouri Rivers. - Doppler radar indicated between 2 and 5 inches of rain from around 5 to 10 miles west of Huff, south to the Missouri River near Fort Rice, and to just north of the Cannonball River, between Solen and Cannon Ball. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Rice.
info.instruction: Do not cross flooded roadways. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
